intro: Trochomeria macrocarpa subsp. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited trochomeria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its biennial growth habit, with the first year producing basal leaves and the second year flowering and fruiting. The plant produces compound umbels of small white flowers, which are followed by spherical, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. This species is native to southern Africa and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats.
